com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.i18n

Class SessionCookieLocaleResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.web.util.CookieGenerator
      • org.springframework.web.servlet.i18n.CookieLocaleResolver
        • com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.i18n.SessionCookieLocaleResolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.web.servlet.LocaleResolver

    public class SessionCookieLocaleResolver
extends org.springframework.web.servlet.i18n.CookieLocaleResolver
    LocaleResolver consults session and cookie in resolving locale.
    Locale will be resolved by the following sequences:
    1. Check in session.
    2. Check in request attribute.
      1. If locale has been set in request attribute, then set locale to session.
    3. If locale has not been set in request attribute, then check in cookie.
      1. If locale has been set in cookie, then set locale to session.
    4. If locale has not been set in cookie, then fall back to the accept-language locale in the request headers.
    Author:
    Arata Y.

      • getLocaleSessionAttributeName

        public String getLocaleSessionAttributeName()
        Getter of session attribute name for locale data.

      • setLocale

        public void setLocale(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
             Locale locale)

        Set locale data to the following places:
        • Request session attribute. Attribute name will be obtained by getLocaleSessionAttributeName() method.
        • Request attribute. Attribute name will be obtained by getLocaleRequestAttributeName() method.
        • Response cookie. Cookie name will be obtained by super.getCookieName method.
        When locale input is null, it obtains default locale by super.determineDefaultLocale method. Then set it to session attribute and request attribute, and remove previously set locale value from cookie.
        When Spring's LocaleChangeInterceptor has been configured and SessionCookieLocaleResolver bean has been added to context, then this will be called from Spring's LocaleChangeInterceptor.preHandle method.
        Specified by:
        setLocale in interface org.springframework.web.servlet.LocaleResolver
        Overrides:
        setLocale in class org.springframework.web.servlet.i18n.CookieLocaleResolver

      • resolveLocale

        public Locale resolveLocale(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

        Locale will be resolved by checking following places in the shown order:
        1. Session attribute. Attribute name will be obtained by getLocaleSessionAttributeName() method.
        2. Request attribute. Attribute name will be obtained by getLocaleRequestAttributeName() method.
        3. Request cookie. Cookie name will be obtained by super.getCookieName method.
        4. Deafult locale what has been set by super.setDefaultLocale method.
        5. Accept-Language header.
        Specified by:
        resolveLocale in interface org.springframework.web.servlet.LocaleResolver
        Overrides:
        resolveLocale in class org.springframework.web.servlet.i18n.CookieLocaleResolver
